intro: Ononis viscosa subsp. polyphylla, commonly known as the many-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces small, pink or white flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically arranged in pairs along the stem. It thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually visited by various pollinators, including bees and flies.
